instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Liquid damage 820-2915 no pm_slp_s4_L for 5V_S3
threads.message:
Hi.

No fan spin whatsoever.

Present rails.

PPBUS
PP3V42
PP5VIN_S5_HS_Computing
PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU
PPVIN_S5_HS_Other
PPDCIN
PPRTC G3H
PP5V_S5
PP3V3_S5

pm_slp_s4_l Diode mode .480V

Liquid damage heavy around U9600, J2550 area, T29 Area and Codec Area. Replaced burnt corroded components around U9600. Started to replace stuff on the other areas but not sure if they are relevant to get power. Dont want to do all that work just to find out the thing is shot. Its been kind of my M.O. lately.
Also, some very light white shit (almost looks like salt) around bottom of U6100 pins and some surrounding areas. Doesnt look green, burnt or caked at all though.

Thanks. Have a good one.

threads.title: Liquid damage 820-2915 no pm_slp_s4_L for 5V_S3
threads.message: Heavy corrosion around U9600 is usually fatal as there are a bunch of probe points that are directly on a via. Post picture please.

threads.title: Liquid damage 820-2915 no pm_slp_s4_L for 5V_S3
threads.message:
Had to change profile due to paypal. Heres pics . [URL]https://photos.app.goo.gl/KOi8z3Co0UkbwC0D2[/URL]
It is pretty bad all around. Replaced everything but the 2 large caps and U9600 itself. Didnt really mess too much with J2550 area. Wasnt sure how important it was for now.

Thanks Duke.

threads.title: Liquid damage 820-2915 no pm_slp_s4_L for 5V_S3
threads.message: I don't know man. This is one of those boards that will probably have multiple failures. When you fix the power issue it will have MUX issues. When you fix the MUX the GPU will die next month. Honestly I would never have touched a board like this.

threads.title: Liquid damage 820-2915 no pm_slp_s4_L for 5V_S3
threads.message: I see. Well its not really a rush. Where can I start for PM_slp_s4? I will worry about he other shit as it comes. It will be a project board I guess.  Thanks Duke. Later.

threads.title: Liquid damage 820-2915 no pm_slp_s4_L for 5V_S3
threads.message: No SLP_S4 could be anything. Using 85W charger? ADAPTER_EN present? PPBUS voltage? Does a battery charge?

threads.title: Liquid damage 820-2915 no pm_slp_s4_L for 5V_S3
threads.message: Orange light on charger with Batt connected. PPBUS is 12.56V. 85 W Charger. Adapter_EN - 3.4V. Thanks.

threads.title: Liquid damage 820-2915 no pm_slp_s4_L for 5V_S3
threads.message: 32KHz from clock chip, crap under PCH? PPVRTC? Voltage on C1802/03?

threads.title: Liquid damage 820-2915 no pm_slp_s4_L for 5V_S3
threads.message: PPVRTC - 3.3V, C1802 - 3.3V, C1803 - 3.3V. I dont have a way of measuring frequency so no idea on pin 12 U2800. PCH looks normal but I cant be sure cause I cant see under it without removing it.

threads.title: Liquid damage 820-2915 no pm_slp_s4_L for 5V_S3
threads.message: It could be anything from PCH to SMC. Checked all rails for shorts?

threads.title: Liquid damage 820-2915 no pm_slp_s4_L for 5V_S3
threads.message:
Not all. Stopped when I saw I was missing 5V_S3. Will do.

Ok man... Have a good day.
